intro: Psychotria dura var. cuneata, commonly known as the cuneata variant of the psychotria dura, is a species native to tropical regions of South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many plants with medicinal and ornamental value. The plant typically features small, elliptical leaves and produces clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests. The species is notable for its potential ethnobotanical uses, though further research is needed to fully understand its properties.
